verses.kjv: Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,
verses.ct: On that day, Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang this song:

verses.kjv: Praise ye the LORD for the avenging of Israel, when the people willingly offered themselves.
verses.ct: "Praise the LORD! When Israel's leaders took charge, the people volunteered willingly."

verses.kjv: Hear, O ye kings; give ear, O ye princes; I, even I, will sing unto the LORD; I will sing praise to the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: "Listen, kings! Pay attention, rulers! I — yes, I — will sing to the LORD; I will make music to the LORD, the God of Israel."

verses.kjv: LORD, when thou wentest out of Seir, when thou marchedst out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, and the heavens dropped, the clouds also dropped water.
verses.ct: "LORD, when you marched out from Seir, when you advanced from the territory of Edom, the earth shook, the heavens poured down, and the clouds released their rain."

verses.kjv: The mountains melted from before the LORD, even that Sinai from before the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: "The mountains quaked in the presence of the LORD — even Sinai trembled in the presence of the LORD, the God of Israel."

verses.kjv: In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied, and the travellers walked through byways.
verses.ct: "During the time of Shamgar son of Anath, during the time of Jael, the main roads were deserted, and travelers took winding back paths instead."

verses.kjv: The inhabitants of the villages ceased, they ceased in Israel, until that I Deborah arose, that I arose a mother in Israel.
verses.ct: "Village life disappeared — it disappeared in Israel — until I, Deborah, stepped forward, until I stepped forward as a mother for Israel."

verses.kjv: They chose new gods; then was war in the gates: was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?
verses.ct: "When the people chose new gods, war came to their city gates. Could even a shield or spear be found among 40,000 in Israel?"

verses.kjv: My heart is toward the governors of Israel, that offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless ye the LORD.
verses.ct: "My heart goes out to the commanders of Israel who volunteered willingly among the people. Praise the LORD!"

verses.kjv: Speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment, and walk by the way.
verses.ct: "Speak up, you who ride on white donkeys, you who sit on fine saddle blankets, and you who walk along the road."

verses.kjv: They that are delivered from the noise of archers in the places of drawing water, there shall they rehearse the righteous acts of the LORD, even the righteous acts toward the inhabitants of his villages in Israel: then shall the people of the LORD go down to the gates.
verses.ct: "At the watering places, free from the sound of enemy archers, there they will retell the righteous acts of the LORD — his righteous acts for the villagers of Israel. Then the people of the LORD marched down to the gates."

verses.kjv: Awake, awake, Deborah: awake, awake, utter a song: arise, Barak, and lead thy captivity captive, thou son of Abinoam.
verses.ct: "Wake up, wake up, Deborah! Wake up, wake up, and sing your song! Get up, Barak! Take your captives, son of Abinoam!"

verses.kjv: Then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobles among the people: the LORD made me have dominion over the mighty.
verses.ct: "Then the survivors came down to join the nobles; the people of the LORD came down to me against the warriors."

verses.kjv: Out of Ephraim was there a root of them against Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.
verses.ct: "From Ephraim came those whose roots were in the fight against Amalek; Benjamin followed with your forces; from Machir the commanders came down, and from Zebulun came those who carry the officer's staff."

verses.kjv: And the princes of Issachar were with Deborah; even Issachar, and also Barak: he was sent on foot into the valley. For the divisions of Reuben there were great thoughts of heart.
verses.ct: "The leaders of Issachar stood with Deborah — yes, Issachar was loyal to Barak, rushing into the valley at his command. But among the clans of Reuben, there was deep inner conflict."

verses.kjv: Why abodest thou among the sheepfolds, to hear the bleatings of the flocks? For the divisions of Reuben there were great searchings of heart.
verses.ct: "Why did you stay among the sheep pens, listening to the shepherds piping for their flocks? Among the clans of Reuben, there was deep soul-searching."

verses.kjv: Gilead abode beyond Jordan: and why did Dan remain in ships? Asher continued on the sea shore, and abode in his breaches.
verses.ct: "Gilead stayed beyond the Jordan. And why did Dan linger by his ships? Asher remained along the coast and stayed by his harbors."

verses.kjv: Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.
verses.ct: "Zebulun was a people who risked their lives to the point of death, and Naphtali did the same on the open heights of the battlefield."

verses.kjv: The kings came and fought, then fought the kings of Canaan in Taanach by the waters of Megiddo; they took no gain of money.
verses.ct: "Kings came and fought — the kings of Canaan fought at Taanach, near the waters of Megiddo — but they carried away no silver plunder."

verses.kjv: They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought against Sisera.
verses.ct: "From the heavens the battle was fought; the stars from their positions in the sky fought against Sisera."

verses.kjv: The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.
verses.ct: "The Kishon River swept them away — that ancient river, the Kishon. March on, my soul, with strength!"

verses.kjv: Then were the horsehoofs broken by the means of the pransings, the pransings of their mighty ones.
verses.ct: "Then the horses' hooves pounded the ground — galloping, galloping went his mighty stallions."

verses.kjv: Curse ye Meroz, said the angel of the LORD, curse ye bitterly the inhabitants thereof; because they came not to the help of the LORD, to the help of the LORD against the mighty.
verses.ct: "'Put a curse on Meroz,' said the angel of the LORD. 'Bitterly curse its inhabitants, because they did not come to help the LORD — to help the LORD against the mighty warriors.'"

verses.kjv: Blessed above women shall Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite be, blessed shall she be above women in the tent.
verses.ct: "Most blessed among women is Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite — most blessed among women who live in tents."

verses.kjv: He asked water, and she gave him milk; she brought forth butter in a lordly dish.
verses.ct: "He asked for water, and she gave him milk; in a magnificent bowl, she brought him cream."

verses.kjv: She put her hand to the nail, and her right hand to the workmen’s hammer; and with the hammer she smote Sisera, she smote off his head, when she had pierced and stricken through his temples.
verses.ct: "She reached for the tent peg with one hand and a workman's hammer with her right hand. She struck Sisera, she crushed his head, she pierced and shattered his temple."

verses.kjv: At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay down: at her feet he bowed, he fell: where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
verses.ct: "At her feet he collapsed, he fell, he lay still. At her feet he collapsed, he fell. Where he collapsed — there he fell, dead."

verses.kjv: The mother of Sisera looked out at a window, and cried through the lattice, Why is his chariot so long in coming? why tarry the wheels of his chariots?
verses.ct: "Through the window Sisera's mother peered out; she cried through the lattice, 'Why is his chariot taking so long to arrive? Why are the hoofbeats of his horses delayed?'"

verses.kjv: Her wise ladies answered her, yea, she returned answer to herself,
verses.ct: "Her wisest attendants answered her, and she kept repeating their words to herself:"

verses.kjv: Have they not sped? have they not divided the prey; to every man a damsel or two; to Sisera a prey of divers colours, a prey of divers colours of needlework, of divers colours of needlework on both sides, meet for the necks of them that take the spoil?
verses.ct: "'They must be finding and dividing the plunder — a girl or 2 for each soldier; colorful garments for Sisera as plunder, colorful embroidered cloth — 2 pieces of embroidered fabric for the neck of the victor.'"

verses.kjv: So let all thine enemies perish, O LORD: but let them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in his might. And the land had rest forty years.
verses.ct: "May all your enemies be destroyed like this, LORD! But may those who love him shine like the sun rising in full strength." And the land had peace for 40 years.
